other_tests.findings: Recanalization of right popliteal and calf veins.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Two years after the initial DVT, the repeat venous ultrasound showed recanalization.

other_tests.findings: D-dimer was low-normal (243 ng/mL, normal <500 ng/mL).
other_tests.changes_over_time: Three months later, the patient presented with recurrent leg discomfort and imaging evidence of acute right common femoral vein thrombosis.
